properties.areaDesc: Venango, PA; Butler, PA; Mercer, PA; Lawrence, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 8:59AM EST until January 8 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
At 859 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from 10 miles northeast of Slippery Rock to near Campbell,
moving southeast at 20 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind
gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 98 and 120.
Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 40.
Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 14.

Locations impacted include...
New Castle, Hermitage, Sharon, Grove City, Farrell, Slippery Rock,
New Wilmington, Oakwood, New Castle Northwest, Mercer, Pulaski and
Bessemer.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EST FOR SOUTHERN MERCER...SOUTHWESTERN VENANGO...LAWRENCE AND NORTHERN BUTLER COUNTIES
